block.p: Re ''Risk of Arms Race Seen in U.S. Design of Missile Defense'' (front page, May 28): In the cold war, the arms race between the United States and the Soviet Union provoked a buildup in China. In response, India maintained its nuclear option, which in turn provoked Pakistan to conduct a clandestine nuclear weapons program.

Re ''Risk of Arms Race Seen in U.S. Design of Missile Defense'' (front page, May 28): In the cold war, the arms race between the United States and the Soviet Union provoked a buildup in China. In response, India maintained its nuclear option, which in turn provoked Pakistan to conduct a clandestine nuclear weapons program.

An American missile defense may now bring China and India closer strategically if they think a secure America will increase the threat of NATO military interventions on humanitarian grounds to prevent suppression of violent secessionist movements. The contrasting lesson from Kosovo and Chechnya is that nuclear weapons deployed on long-range missiles can deter Western humanitarian interventions.
RAJU G. C. THOMAS Milwaukee, May 28, 2000
The writer is a professor of international affairs at Marquette University.
